reviewText: This movie is psychologically disturbing this is a horror movie that does not need extreme gore to be frightful.this jeffey dahmer movie is far superior than the remake.If u read the begining the director was on a budget,and jeffrey dahmer acts would of been to extreme to put on film,but this film was done with the right amount of gore and the story was pretty accurate,and again the director stated a little of the story was changed.To those who like paranormal activity,saw,and mainstream horror will not find anything to like here,stay away.To those who like movies like salo,tenderness of the wolves etc will like this film.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Secret Life Of Jeffrey Dahmer is one of the scariest movies I've seen. It is disturbing, and made even moreso by the fact that this actually happened. Sure there are moments of unintentional hilarity here, but I'm a fan of cheesy b-movies and so-bad-that-it's-good type movies so I didn't have a problem with that. But make no mistake about it, this is not a bad movie. It's a very good one, with a tight pace.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Judge Tom Becker, DVD Verdict-- The Secret Life: Jeffrey Dahmer was released in 1993, a year after Dahmer had been convicted of 15 murders and sentenced to 957 years in prison. While the film opens with a text crawl about the case and features a running narration by the title character, it offers no insight beyond what you could have found in the newspaper accounts of the day, and less than you'd find currently on the Internet. What it offers instead is a steady stream of grindhouse-worthy killings and simplistic psychological musings supposedly from the Monster of Milwaukee himself. There's no social context and no outside voice; this is basically a slasher/exploitation film based--almost too closely, at times--on real events.The film was shot on an extremely low budget. Normally, that wouldn't matter much, but in the case of The Secret Life, it has a terribly disconcerting effect. The Secret Life: Jeffrey Dahmer looks like an exploitation film from the '70s. It also plays like an exploitation film from the '70s, with cheesy performances, stilted dialogue, all that.Only it's not an exploitation film from the '70s, it's a "true crime film" that was produced while the Dahmer wounds were still fresh. While there's a whiff of sincerity about the whole thing that should distinguish it from a "fact-based" grinder like 1971's The Zodiac Killer, it's ultimately so simple-minded and grisly that it works as a horror movie and little else. It recounts the story for maximum shock value, but since there's little here beyond a parade of young men being drugged and sacrificed, it's all rather tedious--not to mention revolting.The disc is a fairly unexciting affair: full frame transfer, stereo sound, and a commentary with Crew and director David R. Bowen. You'd think that since Dahmer was killed in prison in 1994, someone might have updated the closing text, which states, "Dahmer is currently serving 15 consecutive life terms," but apparently, no one got around to that.-Full review at dvdverdict.com
summary: Disturbing in a number of ways--not all of them intentional

reviewText: One of the best Dahmer films made! Carl Crew plays Jeffrey Dahmer in this low-budget horror/true crime film. Carl did a excellent job playing Dahmer especially his looks. Secret Life of Jeffrey Dahmer is a movie base on Dahmer's killings and life, after watching this movie I felted sorry for the victims. But I can't helped feeling a little sorry for Jeffrey being abandon by both parents and then his grandmother. The movie did have gore, not a lot, but enough and the music helped the movie as well. I had seen the dvd release by dead alive I have to say that intervision print looks better. Secret Life of Jeffrey Dahmer is a must own for those who like bizarre films and I love bizarre films!

reviewText: A well handled account of Dahmer's crimes that is more atmospheric than visually revealing. The actor playing Dahmer becomes more and more acceptable as being him than at first.

reviewText: The quality of the movie, at times, has a vhs feel to it. However, out of all the Dahmer based films I have seen so far, this one is the best. It delves into more of what Dahmer did to his victims (though certain scenarios and names were changed). However, after a while, though still disturbing, the murders get a little boring. I hate to say this, but so many men being poisoned and murdered, you start to phase it out. However, dispite the previous sentence, the acts remain disgusting, and disturbing. The acting fluxuates...sometimes good, sometimes passable. The man who played Dahmer, kept his performance going, though some of the other actors couldn't pass as believable characters.Also, this film has a campy feel to it. I would buy this movie again.
Title: N/A
